category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8000000
category.item: Antiquity Fair
The Antiquity Fair has rolled into town! Prepare yourself for fun and herculean prizes!
Haltet ein, oh weiser Stadthalter {PLAYERNAME}, wir beabsichtigen die schöne Helena aus den Klauen der Trojaner zu befreien! Solltet Ihr uns unterstützen, ist Euch unser ewiger Dank gewiss!

Als Nyx uns in der vergangenen Dämmerstunde heimsuchte, eröffnete sich mir ein fantastischer Plan: Im Bauche eines hölzernen Pferdes passieren wir versteckt die Tore von Troja! Könnt Ihr uns mit Holz versorgen?
Was für ein stattliches Ross. Sobald Troja erstürmt ist, dürft Ihr Eure Stadt damit schmücken!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8001000
category.item: Blockhütten-Expo
Saul Bunyan's in town with the Log Cabin Expo! Swing your axe and join the fun!
Endlich ist es soweit, die weltberühmte Blockhütten-Expo kommt in Deine Stadt! Ich bin Jack Lumber, amtierender Holzhack-Weltmeister und Organisator der Expo.
Ich würde ja liebend gerne selbst Hand an die Axt legen, aber aus Zeitgründen würde ich Arbeitsteilung vorschlagen! Du besorgst Holz in rauen Mengen und ich schustere die Blockhütten zusammen!
Herrlich, fast wie im fernen Kanada, meiner trauten Heimat!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8002000
category.item: Weekly Market
Your residents sure love fresh veggies. They're sure to give you goodies in return!

Local, freshly-grown fruit and vegetables are chock full of nutrients! Every delivery comes with a little side of gossip, too! I'll organize a weekly market so that everyone can enjoy fresh produce. What do think?
First, we have to expand the Event Plaza. We need a solid foundation for the market stands. Can you help us? Great, I'll be watching for your delivery.
Great job! The Event Plaza looks perfect. A masterpiece, if I do say so myself.
Everything's ready - the only thing left to do is fill the market stands with local delicacies. I'll bring the goods to the man and I'll be watching for your delivery.
The stands are totally empty! Now your residents are healthy and happy.

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8003000
category.item: La Tomatina
The Tomatina Fest is back, along with the infamous tomato fight. Look out for great prizes!
Kennst Du das spanische "Tomatina-Fest“? Eine riesige Tomatenschlacht in unserer Stadt! Das wird ein Spaß!
Bevor das "Tomatina-Fest" beginnen kann, solltest Du den Festplatz vorbereiten! Ein paar Tribünen und Zäune aus Holz sollten reichen.
Das sieht doch super aus! Der Festplatz ist hergerichtet und schon kann es losgehen!
Klasse! "La Tomatina" kann steigen! Alles was jetzt noch fehlt sind die Tomaten!
Das war ein Spaß! Danke, dass Du uns geholfen hast, das "Tomatina-Fest" zu organisieren! Als Dank haben die Teilnehmer eine kleine Überraschung für Dich!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8004000
category.item: Circus Fettuccine
The circus is in town! Help the Fettuccine Brothers put on a great show and some great prizes could be yours.
The famous Fettuccine Brothers have rolled into the city with their circus! Maybe we can help them out. Come on, let's go take a look.
We need to polish up this circus wagon! To do this, start making lumber and wood shavings in your lumber mill.
That looks a lot better. The Fettuccine Brothers have a reward for you!
Let's feed the animals a hearty meal, so they'll perform even better! On the farm, we can grow hay for the horses and crops for the monkeys!
The animals are stuffed! The Fettuccine Brothers have a reward for you!
Hay
HAY
Circus horses love fresh hay!
Wood chips
WOOD CHIPS
Perfect for tired circus animals that want to curl up and nap!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8005000
category.item: Farmer's Market
Your residents sure love fresh veggies. They're sure to give you goodies in return!
The residents of your city have requested a farmer's market. Let's put one together!
First, we have to get the market ready. Can you go gather the materials needed?
The first step is done. Looks great!
Just a few improvements here and there are needed. Can you go get some more building materials?
Awesome! The stands are done! The market can open!
Plant some delicious, healthy vegetables to sell at the farmer's market. How does this sound? You deliver the vegetables and I'll sell them!
The residents love the farmer's market! Great!
Your residents are buying left and right! We're gonna need more! Let's get the stands full!
Selling high-quality wares to happy customers out in the fresh air - can't ask for anything better!
Your residents still don't have enough! Do you think you can deliver more products?
Well done! We've sold everything. The people are happy! We should do this again soon!
Corn
CORN
Fresh corn, delicious and organic!
Carrots
CARROTS
Crunchy root vegetables are great for soups or a healthy snack!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8006000
category.item: Lumberjack Finals
Do you have what it takes for the Lumberjack Finals? Prove it and reap the sweet rewards!
Great news! The Lumberjack Finals are coming to your city! Help us get ready - it's gonna be so much fun!
Let's get to work; there's so much to do! First we have to get the event plaza ready: You get started on the materials and I'll organize the rest!
Nice job! The plaza looks great! Let's keep going!
We're still missing wood for the sawhorses. Don't forget, we'll also need logs for the contest in your lumber yard!
Perfect! Everything is ready, the Lumberjack Finals can begin!
Amazing! Look at those athletes, they're chopping wood at lightning speed! Quick, we'll need more logs and materials!
The first few contests are done and the tournament is a complete success. Way to go!
Oh no! The axes needed for the contest are late! Maybe we can borrow some from your residents? Please ask them when you go to collect their rent.
Whew, just in time! Thanks to you and your residents, the tournament can continue!
We'll need more axes for the finale of the axe throwing contest. The athletes look tired already. Send them some power bars from your bakery!
Isn't this great?! The Lumberjack Finals were a total success! You've certainly earned this reward! See you next time!
Log
LOG
The ideal material for the Lumberjack Finals.
Axe
AXE
Sharp blades, nonslip handle: A true championship axe!
Power bar
POWER BAR
An energy boost for tired lumberjacks baked from the finest grains!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8007000
category.item: Halloween
Don't be a scaredy-cat! If all goes well, you'll get more treats than tricks this Halloween.
Take a look at your calendar. Halloween is just around the corner! Help us prepare a Halloween festival that's sure to give you goosebumps!
The Event Plaza needs to be reinforced for Halloween, since there will be so many kids present. Bring us some stable logs and roof beams!
Excellent! The Event Plaza is strong enough to hold a herd of elephants!
The forecast says that Halloween is going to be a dry night. But let's not take any chances - gather more roof beams and logs to build a canopy!
Fantastic! The Even Plaza is ready. We can let in the kids!
What's a Halloween without pumpkin carving? And tomatoes to give the Event Plaza a gruesome, bloody look. Give us a hand with that!
Ew, gross! The tomato blood looks just like the real thing!
Halloween is a huge hit with the kids! Look at them lining up. We need more pumpkins and tomatoes as soon as possible!
Great! The kids are having a spooktacular time. What a party!
The kids want to dress up! Your citizens will surely donate old fabric the next time that they pay rent. You can produce wood for broomsticks in your lumber mill.
You did it!! The kids are ready for some trick-or-treat fun!
Last, but not least, we need candy for the perfect Halloween! The kids stream from house to house gathering goodies. Help them out!
Yum, so many treats! The kids are going to be so happy.
Oh no! What's wrong? À hole has opened up in the middle of the Event Plaza - something is trying to climb out! Quick, grab some logs and roof beams! We've got to close it up!
Phew! That was a close call! But I think we've still got a ghost on our hands now!
Boo, you wannabe mayors make me so mad! This piece of land belongs to me, Ebenezer Moneybags! Hm, but for a wooden chest full of gold I'd sell it to you in a flash! Build me one!
What a lovely chest. But it's empty! Is this some kind of trick?!
Now listen up, wannabe mayor! There are gold nuggets lying around all over your city. Get enough to fill the chest and I'll be satisfied! You've got my word!
Wooo! Beautiful gold! The land is yours. You can take these old building permits, I won't be needing them anymore!
Halloween Pumpkin
HALLOWEEN PUMPKIN
This special type of pumpkin is perfectly suited for carving!
Log
LOG
Strengthen your Event Plaza for Halloween with these stable logs!
Candy
CANDY
Yum! Gumdrops, lollipops, and chocolate! What would Halloween be without candy?
Fabric
FABRIC
You can make all sorts of scary costumes from old fabric!
Gold nuggets
GOLD NUGGETS
Sparkling golden nuggets! Too bad the ghost wants them!
Glowing Gaps
Close the glowing gaps in the streets to collect gold nuggets!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8008000
category.item: Circus Fettuccine
The circus is in town! Help the Fettuccine Brothers put on a great show and some great prizes could be yours.
The famous Fettuccine Brothers have arrived in the city with their circus! Maybe we can help them out. Let's go take a look!
The animal enclosures and wagons need to be cleaned and repaired. You'll need to produce sawdust and beams in your lumber mill!
Wow, that looks great! It takes happy animals to put on a great show in the ring.
Speaking of the circus rings... The sawdust and support beams look a little worn out. Let's switch them out! Can you get me some new beams and more sawdust from your lumber mill?
Superb! The circus rings are ready! Onwards!
The circus ponies look hungry! You'll never believe how much these little guys can eat! Get them some carrots and hay from your farm!
Fantastic! The ponies are happy and full. It's almost time for the show!
You won't believe it! The camels have eaten the clown band's costumes! Let's go collect fabric in town, so that we can make some new costumes. Hurry up! The show must go on!
What colorful costumes! Those will be perfect! Great job!

Uh oh! The circus billboards are missing! The delivery service says that the must have fallen off of the truck. You need to look for them on the streets! You can't expect an audience, if no one knows about the show!
Awesome! You saved the show! It was a complete success! The circus is sure to be back in town soon!
Hay
HAY
Healthy and nutritious food for all the circus animals!
Sawdust
SAWDUST
Perfect bedding for tired circus animals!
Carrots
CARROTS
Circus ponies love crunchy carrots!
Fabric
FABRIC
Use this fabric to make new clown costumes!
Circus billboards
CIRCUS BILLBOARDS
No billboards, no visitors! The circus needs advertising!
CIRCUS BILLBOARDS
No billboards, no visitors! The circus needs advertising!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8009000
category.item: Antiquity Fair
Make way for the Antiquity Fair! Enjoy a taste of the ancient times and win great prizes. Onward!
Greetings, Mayor {PLAYERNAME}! Our Antiquity Fair was so successful the last time that we decided to come around again. Can you help us with the preparations?
We'll need to build the stage in the authentic ancient style. We'll need lots of wood to do that!
Wonderful! The stage is done!
Time to build up a theater around the stage. Looks like we'll need more wood.
Wow! The ancient-style open-air theater looks great.
The players are already practicing in the background. A few cheesy breakfast biscuits should give them the energy they need to make it through the day!
Full bellies and smiles all around, excellent work!
The warriors are still hungry. A hearty stew should help boost their energy. We'll need carrots and potatoes.
Everything tasted so delicious and everyone now has a belly full of warm food.
Thanks a million, Mayor! If we could just get a little more gold, then we might be able to make a replica of the Trojan Horse. That would be a big hit at the festival!
Fantastic! The festival was a complete success. The audience was completely enthralled; we filled every seat in the house.
Carrots
CARROTS
Every stew needs plenty of carrots!
Log
LOG
Giant logs are used to stabilize the festival grounds.
Cheese slices
CHEESE SLICES
Real Workers can have a real big appetite! You've probably got some leftover cheese, right?
Scrap gold
SCRAP GOLD
Well-to-do Capitalists donate their scrap gold to the Antiquity Fair.
Carrots
CARROTS
Every stew needs plenty of carrots!
Log
LOG
Giant logs are used to stabilize the festival grounds.

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8010000
category.item: Winterfest
Deck the halls, bundle up, and let it snow! It's time for the Winter Festival!
Whoa! Look at all that snow! I can hardly believe that you made it to the event plaza, Mayor {PLAYERNAME}! Can you help us prepare for the Winter Festival?
The beams and stable logs from your lumber yard are just the materials we need to build up our stands. Go out and get some so that we can start the construction!
Excellent! The builders are making so much progress. Keep it up!
It's still snowing! Hm, we're going to need more wood so that the weight of the snow doesn't collapse the stands. Rev up your saws again!
Wow, it's definitely going to hold now! The stands look so festive covered in snow.
I've got a great idea! Let's decorate the event plaza in the style of a wintery forrest! Plant some fir trees and mistletoe on your farm. We'll take care of the rest!
Fantastic! The Winter Festival looks like a snowy village in the Alps. How cozy!
Mmm, what's that delicious smell? The residents in your city have been baking cookies. When you go to collect their rent, they're sure to donate a fresh batch!
So many cookies! Your residents have really outdone themselves this time. Great job!
Your residents love to bake and it's the time of year where gingerbread men are on the menu. See if they'll donate a few when you pass by to collect rent!
Well done! Happy faces all around. What a wonderful festival!
Have you heard? Your residents want to play a round of Secret Santa! Collect their presents and you can hand them out later. This is going to be fun!
Way to go! Everyone is sure to get a treat with this mountain of gifts!
Brrr, it's freezing out here! How about a nice, hot spiced punch for the Winter Festival? That'll warm everyone up. Plant grapes and raspberries on your farm!
Yum! The punch is delicious. Such a lovely way to warm up!
Did you remember the gifts? It looks like most of the residents aren't too thrilled with what they received. Typical! Come on, let's go gather them up and re-distribute them!
The Winter Festival was a complete success! Everything went according to plan. We'll have to do this again next year!
Could you do us one more favor? There are so many old, dried out fir trees lying around the city. Help us clean up the city by collecting them!
Awesome! Dried out trees can be a real fire hazard. Thanks for cleaning them up so quickly!
Fir tree
FIR TREE
Big, beautiful, and lush! Get your ornaments ready!
Log
LOG
Use to build stands or support beams, stable logs will always do the trick!
Grapes
GRAPES
The best fruits make the best winter punch!
Cookie
COOKIE
Need more homemade cookies? Here you go!
Gingerbread man
GINGERBREAD MAN
Kids and adults both love to snack on freshly baked gingerbread men!
Gift
GIFT
Everyone get's a gift at the Winter Festival. I wonder what's inside?
Old fir tree
OLD FIR TREE
So many old fir trees - time to get rid of them!
Mistletoe
MISTLETOE
A smooch 'neath the mistletoe? How romantic! The perfect winter decoration!
Unwrapped gift
UNWRAPPED GIFT
It's time to exchange gifts in Rising Cities. Re-distribute the gifts to make everyone happy!
Gingerbread man
GINGERBREAD MAN
Kids and adults both love to snack on freshly baked gingerbread men!
Old fir tree
So many old fir trees. Time to throw them out!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8011000
category.item: Flea Market
The charity flea market is swinging through town for donations. How many can you collect?
Good news, Mayor! A charity flea market is coming to our city. Helping out would be great publicity!
First, we need to prepare the city square for the event. Let’s gather some resources from the lumber mill.
Looking good! These resources will be essential to building the flea market.
Volunteers are now hard at work building the flea market. Let’s get them some fresh snacks from the farm!
The flea market is finished! It seems like the snacks gave the volunteers the extra boost they needed.
Any good flea market needs a lot of fun items to sell. Let’s ask the citizens for donations when we collect rent.
These donations are a great starting point. We still need more to fill out the flea market, though.
We still need some more items to sell. Try asking the capitalists for an extra donation when you collect rent.
This looks great! These donations will definitely sell!
We’re just about done, and we almost sold out of everything! The press is looking for pictures of the mayor doing ordinary work. Why don’t you help clean up the streets?
The flea market was a huge success! And look what I found between some old books... a permit for a beautiful Tenement!
Log
LOG
Strengthen your Event Plaza for the flea market with these stable logs!
Carrots
CARROTS
Crunchy carrots are a perfect and healthy snack!
Trash
TRASH
You collected this trash from the streets after the flea market.
Teddy
TEDDY
Donated teddy bears from the homes of workers.
Jewelry
JEWELRY
Capitalists donated gold trinkets to sell at the flea market.
Vases
VASES
Decorative vases from capitalist households.
TRASH
Trash that visitors to the flea market threw away.

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8012000
category.item: Valentine's Day
TODO: Newsscreeen
It's almost Valentine's Day, but love is definitely not in the air. You'll need to act fast to get your unromantic citizens in the mood for love!
Why not throw a Valentine's Dance on the event plaza? The workers will need ebony to transform the plaza into the perfect romantic setting.
Way to go! You're off to a great start. There are still a few bare spots that could use a little improvement!
Collect more materials so that the Valentine's Dance can go off without a hitch!
Looking good! The dance floor looks great! You've really outdone yourself. Now we just need to invite the guests.
Grow red roses on your farm to give to each guest. That should work like a charm!
Fantastic! We're sure to have a lot more guests now!
What about a small buffet for the dance? Strawberries are considered to be quite the seductive fruit. Grow a few bushels on your farm and see if it's true!
Great job. Strawberries certainly live up to their reputation! However, we'll need an alternative for the guests with allergies.
Sweet, red cherries are the perfect choice to romantic food and drink. Grow enough cherries on your farm, so that we'll have enough for everyone!
Perfect! Now everyone can enjoy some sweet fruit!
Here's an idea: Collect phone numbers from citizens the next time you go to collect their rent. Then you can mix up the numbers and each resident can choose one. Blind dates for everyone!
Impressive! Look how many people have participated! Now we just need to mix up the numbers and...NO! A gust of wind!
The wind blew the phone numbers all over the city. You'll need to collect them all so the citizens can go on their blind dates!
You're the world's best mayor! Let the raffle begin!
The couples have found each other, but blind dates can be a bit awkward. Bake a few cupcakes to lighten the mood!
Sweets for the sweethearts! Look at everyone getting along!
The Valentine's Dance was a huge success! The city is now full of lovebirds exchanging love letters and diamond rings. Collect the presents and make sure they get to the intended recipients!
How wonderful! Your city can now claim the title "City of Love"! What do you think of that? Congratulations!
Cherry
CHERRY
Red, round, and sweet. If you're not into strawberries, there are always cherries!
Ebony
EBONY
The dark ebony wood will compliment the red Valentine's decorations in the Event Plaza.
Red rose
RED ROSE
A bouquet of red roses is the perfect way to declare your love!
Strawberry
STRAWBERRY
Strawberries are a must-have for any romantic meal!
Phone number
PHONE NUMBER
Need a few more digits to set up blind dates? Here you go!
Scattered phone number
SCATTERED PHONE NUMBER
Collecting phone numbers is hard work, looks like these were blown away!
Cupcake
CUPCAKE
Yummy! A cherry-strawberry muffin! Sweets for your sweety!
Love letter
LOVE LETTER
Your workers love to write letters to their sweethearts. How romantic!
Diamond ring
DIAMOND RING
Sparing no expense, your capitalists give their sweeties sparkling ring bling!
PHONE NUMBER LIST
Collect these lists to re-gain phone numbers blown away by the wind!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8013000
category.item: Easter
It's Easter and there's lots to get done before the celebration. Hop to it!
Spring has sprung! Aspiring Easter bunnies are ready to dye and hide lots of eggs. Time to get started with the prep work, Mayor. Hop to it!
Look out! After a long, dreary winter, the Event Plaza looks a little swampy. You'll need to reinforce the ground with wood from your lumber mill!
Looks good and stable! The wood reinforcements should hold up. Great job!
Chop-chop, Mayor! No sleeping on the job. Whip this place into shape with some decorations. Daffodils from the farm and solid ebony should do nicely!
Beautiful! Atchoo...oops, sorry! It certainly smells like Spring in here. A bit of hay fever just gives it an extra authentic touch!
You can't have Easter without the dyed eggs. Crank out some organic eggs from your farm and collect egg dye from your residents the next time you collect rent!
Well, color me surprised! You finished that in a flash. The eggs are dyed and hidden. Let's do this!
Wow! Your residents are so generous! They've decided to donate choco-bunnies to all of the kiddies at the Easter celebration. Go door-to-door to collect the chocolate and to say thanks!
*Omnomnom* These choco-bunnies are delish! But there's no time for snacking right now. You've still got work to do!
Uh oh! Your "Easter bunny" helpers got carried away with hiding the eggs. They've hidden them all over the city, instead of the Event Plaza. Help them search for the eggs!
If you weren't already mayor, you could have been a professional egg hunter. Well, if such a thing even existed. Congrats! You found them all!

Um, Mayor? We've got another problem. The Easter eggs...they're...hatching?! Looks like some of them weren't hard-boiled and now there are fluffy little chicks running around the city! We're going to need wood to build them some chicken coops!
Wow! Talk about a strange day! All the chicks have been found and moved to a farm where they'll have plenty of space.

We're running short on time. The baby chick fiasco put us off schedule. There's still an Easter bonfire to organize. Quick! There's brushwood at the lumber mill and perhaps your residents still have old fir trees from the holidays!
Not bad, Mayor! That's an impressive mountain of dried wood. The bonfire will be blazing in no time!
Don't forget. Your guests will need some refreshments while sitting around the bonfire. How about a traditional Easter snack? The bakery can whip up some loaves of Easter bread!
Between the choco-bunnies and Easter bread, I'm stuffed! Ok, maybe I'll just have one more slice...
Almost time to light the bonfire! But first, let's make a toast. Make sure everyone has something to drink. Beer for the workers and champagne for the capitalists!
Well done! The Easter bonfire is perfect: big, warm, and bright! The guests are gobbling up the Easter bread and clinking glasses! This celebration is your biggest hit yet!
Log
LOG
Perfect for reinforcing your Event Plaza!
Organic eggs
ORGANIC EGGS
Happy chickens make happy eggs! Ready to paint!
Egg dye
EGG DYE
Dye your organic eggs with a rainbow of colors!
Easter bread
EASTER BREAD
Fresh Easter bread - a delightful treat for your hungry guests!
Choco-bunny
CHOCO-BUNNY
Are your residents short on choco-bunnies? Get more here!
Easter eggs
EASTER EGGS
Colorful Easter eggs are a must-have!
Champagne
CHAMPAGNE
A bit of bubbly for the capitalists. Raise your glasses!
Daffodil
DAFFODIL
Arrange a lovely bouquet or plant a few in your garden. Daffodils are the essence of springtime!
Old fir tree
OLD FIR TREE
The old, dried up remains of the holiday season. Perfect bonfire material!
Ebony
EBONY
Decorative ebony for a real touch of class!
Brushwood
BRUSHWOOD
Bits of brushwood to spark your Easter bonfire!
Chick
CHICK
Cute little baby chicks are always a big Easter hit!
Beer
BEER
Students and workers love to toss back a few cold ones!
Easter nest
Easter nests are the perfect hiding place for Easter eggs!
Nest
Find the baby chicks hiding in these nests!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8014000
category.item: Biker Rally
Look at all these motorcycles! Bikers are streaming into town for the rally. Vroooom!
Mayor, this spring time weather makes me want to jump on my motorcycle and take a road trip. I know we're so busy here in town, but maybe instead, we could host a biker rally right here!
We can? Really?! Awesome! Let's start the prep work. Of course, we need to reinforce the Event Plaza so it can hold those heavy bikes.
The Event Plaza could probably hold up a tank or two. Nice job!
Bikers do love to eat. We'll need plenty of fries and beer. Grow enough potatoes on the farm and place an order at the micro-brewery for beer!
Just in time! The first bikers are starting to roll into town!
Uh oh, Mayor! We've got a problem! Some of the residents have been complaining about the motorcycle noise. They've written complaint letters and you need to collect them the next time rent is due!
Picking up the complain letters personally was a genius move, Mayor! Well done!

Beer and hot dogs for everyone! We're almost out of brown ale and our meat situation doesn't look so hot. I've got it! We just need to grow some soybeans on the farm and then the bakery can make tofu dogs! No one will even know the difference!
See? I told you! The bikers can't tell the difference between the tofu dogs and the real thing!

Hooray! It's time for the motorcycle parade! Some of the bikers aren't wearing helmets. That's not safe at all. And Chief Slowgo definitely doesn't look pleased! Let's borrow some helmets from the residents.
What a thrill! The parade was a big hit! Keep it up and we'll start getting international recognition for our celebrations!
Log
LOG
Reinforce the Event Plaza for the Biker Rally with some reliable logs!
Brown ale keg
BROWN ALE KEG
Bikers are a thirsty bunch, you'll definitely need a few kegs of brown ale!
Complaint letter
COMPLAINT LETTER
Collecting complaint letters can be difficult - get them here instead!
Soybeans
SOYBEANS
The main ingredient in tofu dogs!
Tofu dogs
TOFU DOGS
Tofu dogs taste (almost) just like real hot dogs!
Helmet
HELMET
Safety first! Every biker needs a helmet!
Tofu sausage
TOFU SAUSAGE
Tofu dogs taste (almost) just like real hot dogs!
Helmet
HELMET
Safety first! Every biker needs a helmet!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8015000
category.item: Children's Festival
Think of the children! It's time to do something just for them. What about a Children's Festival?

Oh man, I'm really beat! My niece is in town. I've taken her everywhere, but she still says the city is too boring for kids. She's a smart alec, for sure, but maybe a Children's Festival will change her mind!
This will be a big challenge, Mayor. Especially since we have to keep safety a priority. Lots of hay should do the trick!
Great! Soft hay and rounded edges will really prevent some nasty accidents!
Let's try to set a good example and avoid pumping the kids full of candy. How about organic apples? We can grow them right on the farm!
Yum, crunchy apples and...tomatoes? Ah, good thinking! The people in this town are crazy about tomatoes!
A Children's Festival is the perfect opportunity for a toy swap. Collect old toys when you go to pick up the next rent and the kids can choose a toy at the festival.
Look at all the smiling faces! Let's go play a game with the kids!
Whoa! That escalated quickly! You were supposed to keep things under control, Mayor. Now there are balloons and soccer balls all over the city. Could you at least help me collect them?
Whew! Did we get them all? Looks like it. Fantastic! Thanks for your help!
Well, whaddya know, Mayor? Looks like this city isn't so boring after all. The kids had a great time and made some finger paintings to say thanks. You can collect them the next time rent is due!
What a great day! The Children's Festival was a success and my niece is definitely singing a new tune!
Hay
HAY
Soft hay for the Children's Festival, safe and fun!
Organic apple
ORGANIC APPLE
Sweet organic apples are a healthy treat for growing kids!
Old toys
OLD TOYS
You'd rather play with the kids, instead of collecting old toys? You can pick them up here!
Balloons
BALLOONS
Don't feel like chasing balloons all over the city? Then take these!
Soccer ball
SOCCER BALL
Don't feel like chasing soccer balls down the road? Here are a few you can use!
Finger painting
FINGER PAINTING
Aww! Cute finger paintings to hang up on the fridge or in your office!
Balloons
Collect the balloons quickly before they cause an accident!
Soccer ball
Collect the soccer balls before someone gets hurt!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8016000
category.item: Classic Car Show
Rev your engine and show off your hot rod at the Classic Car Show. You might go home with 1st place!
Mayor Tenenbaum, from our sister city Newfield, is looking for a location to hold a Classic Car Show. We could host that, right?
After the race, the cars will be on display for the visitors. We're a little short on parking spaces, so we'll need to expand. Some soft hay will also protect the cars from getting scratched up!
Wow, that was quick! Thank goodness, too! The race has already started and the cars are on their way here!
The classic cars are still a long way off. The drivers are sure to be hungry when they arrive. Plant some potatoes and carrots on your farm. You can feed them french fries and salad!
Great! Everything looks ready! We just have to wait for the cars to cross the finish line!

What a rush! The first classic cars are crossing the finish line! But what's that over there? A few of the cars have lost parts along the way. Those could turn into real road hazards. Hurry and clean them up!
Whew! The streets are clear, but the cars look worse for wear.
Those beautiful cars! It's tough to see them in this condition. Why not ask your residents for tools the next time you collect rent!
I knew we could count on your residents. The classic cars look good as new! Time for the awards ceremony!
Mayor, we've got a problem! The prizes have disappeared! Quick! The brickyard can produce some clay figurines for the participants and we can crown the winner with laurels from your farm.
Hooray! The race and award ceremony were a big hit! Time to go look at the classic cars.
You successfully purchased the top prize!
Hay
HAY
Soft hay protects valuable classic cars from scratches.
Carrots
CARROTS
Crunchy veggies for healthy Classic Car Show snacks.
Laurel
LAUREL
Even the Ancient Greeks used laurels to crown their victors.
Car parts
CAR PARTS
Haven't found all of the car parts? Get more here.
Figurine
FIGURINE
A little souvenir for all Classic Car Show participants.
Toolbox
TOOLBOX
Contains any tool that you might need for repairing classic cars.
Lost car parts
Collect discarded car parts to repair classic cars later!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8017000
category.item: Art Expo
Dust off your paints and paintbrushes, it's time for the Art Expo! Win cool prizes while the whole city takes part!
It's time to bring a bit of culture to the city, Mayor! Let's organize an interactive Art Expo. The residents can take part in workshops, learn about various crafts and take home their works of art!

Before the art expo workshops can begin, the multi-functional gallery needs to be built! You'll need space and materials for painting, sculpting...the works! Produce enough wood to make your artistic vision a reality!
Looks great, Mayor! Now we'll just have to see what kind of masterpieces your residents create!
For the pottery class, we'll need lots of clay. And tomatoes. Before you ask, I've got no idea why we need tomatoes either, Mayor. Never question an artist's integrity!
Those bowls look amazing! Hard to believe what you can make out of clay and a few tomatoes. Looks like you made something too, Mayor. What exactly is it supposed to be?
A woodworking woodshop! How wonderful! We just have to wrangle up some spare roof beams and paint for decorating. The workers are sure to have a few old paint cans lying around!
Wow! Take a look at these creations. They look so professional! I'd hang a few pictures in these stylish wooden frames, for sure!
There's even a workshop for the kids! The Crafts for Kids area needs costume jewelry and friendship bracelets. Those sound like just the things for the capitalists and students to donate!
Great job! This just goes to show that you're never too old or young for art!

Uh oh! Where there's art, there's Pranksy the notorious street artist. He's been displaying odd little statues all around the city. Maybe it's an artistic statement, but also a traffic hazard, thanks to all of the rubbernecking drivers.
Whew! That was close! The statues have been cleaned up and the workshops have been a huge hit. Give yourself a pat on the back!
Way to go! You purchased the top prize!
Log
LOG
Stable logs turn the Event Plaza into a multi-functional art gallery!
Clay
CLAY
Sculptors-in-training need plenty of clay from the brickyard!
Paint Can
PAINT CAN
Collect cans of paint from workers and spread the colors on the canvasses!
Costume jewelry
COSTUME JEWELRY
Combine pieces of old costume jewelry from wealthy residents to craft into trendy, new accessories!
Friendship bracelets
FRIENDSHIP BRACELETS
Colorful friendship bracelets woven by arts-n-crafty students!
Mini-he statue
MINI-HE STATUE
Find the mini-he statues hidden all over town by notorious street artist, Pranksy.
Mini-she statue
MINI-SHE STATUE
Find the mini-she statues hidden all over town by notorious street artist, Pranksy.
Street art
Pranksy the street artist makes his artistic statement by hiding odd little statues all over the city.
Street art
Pranksy the street artist makes his artistic statement by hiding odd little statues all over the city.

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8018000
category.item: Happy Birthday!
Rising Cities is turning one year old! Time to take a look back at what you accomplished this year. Join in the fun!
Look at how the time flies, Mayor! Let's celebrate our city's birthday by re-creating some of the best events from the past year. It's party time!
Valentine's Day sure made lots of residents swoooon! Crank up the romance again with rose bouquets and love letters!
I'm blushing! Is it warm in here or just me? Not all residents are into that mushy stuff, though. Here's a letter from a fan of our cool Winter Festival!
The snow! The presents! The Winter Festival was positively magical, Mayor. With mistletoe and gingerbread men, we can re-live all of the memories!
Yummy gingerbread! I'm stuffed. A mini Winter Festival in the summer is nice, but can you guess which event the residents asked for next?
Our springtime Easter event was a real hit! Everyone in town had fun dyeing eggs, hunting for eggs, catching baby chicks. We can re-create it all! Just don't forget the chocolate bunnies!
What a treat! The kids in this town really love Easter. We ought to make a note of that. Plenty of candy is right up their alley! So, what's up next?
Spooky, scary Halloween! Trick-or-treating is always a fun time. The residents love collecting candy and carving jack-o-lanterns from pumpkins!
No ghouls here! Just lots of fun! The compliments are pouring in...
You've gotten quite popular, Mayor. Congratulations on the successful year! We need to throw a party to mark the occasion. Help me get some cake and collect the party hats strewn about the town!
Oh, my hero! Once again, thanks to you, the event was a smashing success! Three cheers for our wonderful mayor and happy birthday, Rising Cities!
Way to go! You purchased the top prize!
Rose Bouquet
ROSE BOUQUET
Nothing says romance like a bouquet of bright red roses!
Love letter
LOVE LETTER
Love is in the air, again! Collect love letters from your residents.
Pumpkin
PUMPKIN
Produce spooktacular jack-o-lantern pumpkins on your farm!
Easter Eggs
EASTER EGGS
Re-live memories of Easter with these colorful eggs!
Gingerbread Man
GINGERBREAD MAN
Yummy gingerbread men are a delicious treat year-round.
Chocolate Bunny
CHOCOLATE BUNNY
Hippity hop! Chocolate bunnies from your residents let you savor sweet Easter memories!
Mistletoe
MISTLETOE
Grow mistletoe on your farm and your residents can smooch all year long!
Candy
CANDY
Mmm, sweets, lollipops, and chocolate! What would Halloween be without candy?
Birthday Cake
BIRTHDAY CAKE
Bake the best birthday cake for the best city - yours!
Party hat
PARTY HATS
Put on your hats and get ready to party!
Hidden Eggs
Find the colorful Easter eggs hidden around the city!
Lost Hats
A gust of wind blew the party hats away! Go find them!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8019000
category.item: Winter Games
Bundle up! The Winter Games have arrived! Get ready for athleticism, sportsmanship, and awesome prizes!
Don't you just love winter, Mayor? The weather's perfect for all sorts of winter sports. We should host a Winter Games event, so fans and athletes from all over can get in on the fun!
Time to get to it, Mayor! If we're going to pull this off, we'll need lots of flagpoles so the visiting fans and athletes can show their hometown pride!
We're off to a great start! I've got a feeling that the Winter Games are going to be a big hit!
The spectators are going to need something to munch. With so many competitors, the games will take awhile. Chips and peanuts are always a big hit!
Delish! No rumbling stomachs in these crowds. All eyes will be on the ice!
How could we have forgotten the flags? Empty flagpoles look a bit silly. Our residents can help pitch in with sewing them and you just have to pick them up with the rent!
Wonderful craftsmanship, wouldn't you say? I knew we could rely on our residents!
Everyone's gone above and beyond for the Winter Games. We've got so many flags, that they outnumber the poles. We'll need to produce more flagpoles, if we want our games to be the best!
You're really on top of everything, Mayor! The flags are waving high above the city in a sea of color!
Fans and flags everywhere! The crowd is even larger than we expected, however. We're definitely going to need more snacks!
Fantastic! Now we've got enough food for everyone!
Mayor! Several bus-loads of new competitors just arrived in town! It's a pleasant surprise, but a surprise nonetheless! We'll need more flags to help cheer them on during the games!
Stunning! With this many flags, the city's covered in color!
What if we built statues commemorating various winter sports? I think that's a task for the brickyard; they're raring to go. They just need the materials!
Top notch! The statues look amazing, like something right out of ancient times!
We'll need to re-stock the snacks, Mayor. People are starting to ask for seconds...and thirds. Don't make them wait! See if the farmers can help us out!
That was a close call, but you did it! Bright eyes and full bellies all around!
The spectators need something to wash down all those salty snacks. I think the brewery can whip up some sports drinks. That'll put some pep in their steps!
So refreshing! These sports drinks have plenty of electrolytes to keep the crowd energized!
A few more winter sports have been added to the program. You'll need to go back to the brickyard to pick up more statues. They've already got their hammers ready!
Well done! Now we have a statue depicting every winter sport under the sun!
The games have started and it's nearly time to declare all of the winners. Each victor will be rewarded with a flag. Collect more from your residents!
Wonderful! The first winners are already on the podiums. Look at their flags wave in the breeze!
What a day! Food, fun, and sportsmanship! The athletes are exhausted from the competition. Let's surprise them with some refreshing sports drinks!
Now that's what I call refreshment! Another successful event all thanks to you, Mayor!
Flagpole
FLAGPOLE
Fans from around the world need flagpoles to hoist their colors!
Snacks
SNACKS
Watching winter sports and eating yummy snacks is an unbeatable combo!
Sports Drink
SPORTS DRINK
Make sure the visiting athletes get plenty of electrolytes with sports drinks!
Statues
STATUES
Statues are a great way to remind everyone of the sportsmanship of the Winter Games!
Flags
FLAGS
Hoist a flag atop a flagpole and show pride for your local athletes!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8020000
category.item: Rock Fest
Ready to rock? The city's buzzing about the big Rock Fest coming to town. There's plenty of work to do, so jump right in!
Remember the Biker Rally, Mayor? The bikers had such a great time that they'd like to come back to our fair city for a Rock Fest. Let's go!
First things first, we'll need a sturdy stage that can withstand anything these rockers can throw at it! Quality plywood from the lumber mill ought to do the trick.
Now that's what I call a main stage! Stable and ready for action. Would you like to try a stage dive, Mayor?
Headbanging can be pretty exhausting, so we also need to make sure that out visitors have plenty to eat and drink. I know! Let's serve pretzels and beer!
Yum! I love the smell of fresh pretzels! And I just know the concert goers will love this freshly brewed beer!

The residents are so excited about the Rock Fest that they even bought extra tickets so that anyone who wants to can attend the festival! Pick up the tickets from them and some extra mulch, while you're at it!
Rockin'! Isn't it great how we can always rely on the generosity of our residents?
Mayor, quick! The crowds are getting restless and fighting over concert merchandise lying in the street! Help the fans calm down and clean up the streets so everyone stays safe!
Whew! That was close, but you handled it like a pro. Thanks, Mayor!
It's showtime! The bands have arrived and are ready to rock our socks off! Let's show them our appreciation by passing out lighters for everyone to hold up during the songs. It'll be unforgettable!
Awesome! I haven't been to a show like that in years. The bands were amazing and the visitors loved it. Another successful event, boss!
Way to go! You purchased the top prize!
Plywood
PLYWOOD
Produce sturdy plywood in the lumber mill!
Pretzel
PRETZEL
Bake delicious pretzels in the bakery to feed the hungry crowd!
Concert Tickets
CONCERT TICKET
Collect donated concert tickets from your residents to help promote the Rock Fest!
Mulch
MULCH
Produce mulch in the mill and you'll have less of a muddy mess to clean up later!
Calm Fans
CALM FANS
Calm fans are the key to throwing a fun festival that's also safe!
Concert Merchandise
CONCERT MERCHANDISE
Concert merchandise is the perfect Rock Fest souvenir!
Lighter
LIGHTER
Set the mood by waving a few lighters in the air! Ask your workers to donate a few.
Teddy bear
TEDDY BEAR
Teddy bears from your students are great keepsakes to help the bands remember this rockin' festival!
Rioting Fans
Prevent hyped up fans from blocking the streets and causing a ruckus!
Abandoned Merchandise
Looks like someone forgot to pick up this merchandise!

category.name: rcl.citysquarequests.8021000
category.item: Soccer Party
Hey, Mayor! You'll get a real kick out of this exciting soccer-themed adventure!
Yo, boss! Whaddya say we roll out the green carpet for the athletes attending our big soccer party? Rustle up some grass from the boys on the farm, would ya?
Way to go, chief! That's one mean and lean soccer field. Our work's not done yet. Let's go.
Ok, time for the warm-up match. There's the whistle... and... Why are the players twiddling their thumbs? Where's the... oh. Oops. Forgot the ball.
Niiiice! Can't have a kickoff without something to kick, am I right? I think I'm coming down with a case of soccer fever.
Hole-y moly! Look at the bleachers; they're full of termites. They need to be replaced before the competition begins or we'll be in a whole lot of trouble!
Perfect! The fans will be safe and sound in these bleachers. Wanna test them out and start a wave?
Aw crud! The players are wandering around the field like hypnotized chickens. Wait, I've got it! Some chalk lines on the field should help.
Top notch work, Mayor! Outlining the field in chalk puts us right up there with the big leagues.
Now the ball's rolling! But... the spectators still look a bit bored. Maybe these custom fan scarves will get them pumped!
Fan-tastic! Get it? The fans can show their team spirit and I gotta say that these scarves are quite the fashion statement, as well!
It's all fun and games until the stomach rumbles are louder than the action on the field. Better break out the snacks before we have a riot on our hands!
Now that's what I call fast food! You've got the public eating right out of your hand.
I didn't mean for you to put everyone in a food coma. Perhaps a cold brewski or two will shake things up a bit! What's soccer without beer?
OLÈ, OLÈ, OLÈ! GREAT JOB! *HIC*... WHAT? WHADDISAY?

It's go time! Hold up! Where'd the balls go? Have the refs been drinking or something?

Oh, right.
You're on a roll! Keep this up and the fans might just name you MVP.
Whew! Finally kickoff time! The fans might need a few more baked snacks. That'll keep their hands busy if the game doesn't go their way.
GOOOOAAAAAAL! And it's a tie! Everyone's going home happy. Gotta love a good soccer match!
Way to go! You purchased the top prize!
Grass
GRASS
No synthetic turf here! Play a match or ten on 100% natural green grass.
Soccer Balls
SOCCER BALLS
Dribble these balls down the field like a pro. Don’t forget: no hands allowed!
Plywood
PLYWOOD
Turn every seat into the best seat in the house with bleachers made of homegrown plywood.
Chalk
CHALK
Fine white chalk on the field keeps the fun safely inbounds.
Scarves
SCARVES
Show your true colors with an official team scarf!
Beer
BEER
Crack open a cold one, while you sit back and watch the match.
Snacks
SNACKS
Healthy snacks! Local and fresh from the farm.
Baked Snacks
BAKED SNACKS
Sports events are the perfect excuse to sneak in a bit of carbo-loading.
Fan Merch
Real fans don’t just go to the games; they dress the part to support their home team.
